item.title: Google Meet’s automatic framing is now available to everyone
item.description:
Google Meet is making it easier for everyone to position themselves in video calls without having to move the camera or mess around with the webcam’s frame adjustment settings. The automatic framing feature that was launched for Google Workspace accounts in 2022 is now rolling out for all Google Meet users, centering users in the middle of the screen to correct weird camera angles.

The toggle is enabled by default, but can be switched off by clicking the three-dot menu before you join a call, selecting “Apply visual effects,” and clicking “Appearance.” It’s similar to Apple’s Center Stage feature, but Google’s version doesn’t track users as they move to keep them in frame — which can help reduce distractions in meetings.

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Jess Weatherbed

item.title: UberXXL will let you catch an even bigger ride to the airport
item.description:
Uber has launched a new airport-only fare option in its ride-sharing app called UberXXL. It surpasses UberXL’s single X by guaranteeing rides with trunk space that can handle large families with lots of big bags — no more sitting at the curb trying to figure out what to do next.

The new option is available today at more than 60 airports worldwide, with more coming down the road. In terms of pricing, UberXXL will sit somewhere between UberXL and Uber Black, the company says. XXL also adds a stopgap before Uber Shuttle, the charter-style option it launched in New York last month that lets you book up to five seats for a trip to the airport with discounted rates and protection against surge pricing.

T...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Quentyn Kennemer

item.title: Tata Elxsi, DENSO and AAtek inaugurate robotics and automation innovation lab in Frankfurt
item.description: The lab, located at Tata Elxsi's Frankfurt office, will serve as a research and development hub. It will feature modular automation demonstrations and focus on accelerating product development and simplifying maintenance. This initiative aims to address the increasing global demand for automation solutions.

item.title: Continental to unveil innovative invisible biometrics sensing display at CES 2025
item.description: Continental will showcase a new display at CES 2025. The display uses cameras and lasers to monitor passenger health and safety. It can detect vital signs and even check if seatbelts are fastened correctly. This technology is hidden within the display and is invisible to the eye. Continental received a CES Innovation Award for this technology.

item.title: Stellantis unveils technology to support flexible EV production, delays Ram electric pickup
item.description: Trump carries out plans to unravel various incentives around EV production and sales. Trump's transition team is planning to kill the USD 7,500 consumer tax credit for electric-vehicle purchases as part of broader tax-reform legislation, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters last week.

item.title: Meet the Acharya brothers; they helped enable DVDs, now they are turning cars into computers
item.description: Margi created the first widely available Personal Computer Memory Card International Association (PCMCIA) card that enabled full DVD playback on laptops. It is a standard for peripheral cards used in laptops.

item.title: Portugal’s Tekever raises $74M for dual-use drone platform deployed to Ukraine
item.description:
Dual-use drone startup Tekever has raised €70 million ($74 million) to develop its product and expand into new markets, specifically the U.S.. The news is part of a trend of smaller tech-driven startups moving into markets normally dominated by large ‘defense primes’. It also shows that unmanned aerial drones are becoming far more sophisticated, in […]

item.title: UK crashes out of global top 50 supercomputer ranking
item.description:
The U.K. no longer has a supercomputer in the top 50, according to new data from the Top500 project, which ranks the 500 most powerful non-distributed computer systems globally. The country’s current national supercomputer system, Archer2, is approaching end-of-life in 2026. According to the latest figures, it’s also now sitting in 62nd place globally, down […]

item.title: UK open to social media ban for kids as gov’t kicks off feasibility study
item.description:
The U.K. government is not ruling out further beefing up existing online safety rules by adding an Australian-style ban on social media for under 16s technology secretary, Peter Kyle, has said. Back in the summer the government warned it may toughen laws for tech platforms in the wake of riots that were perceived to have […]

item.title: OpenAI releases a teacher’s guide to ChatGPT, but some educators are skeptical
item.description:
OpenAI envisions teachers using its AI-powered tools to create lesson plans and interactive tutorials for students. But some educators are wary of the technology — and its potential to go awry. Today, OpenAI released a free online course designed to help K-12 teachers learn how to bring ChatGPT, the company’s AI chatbot platform, into their […]

item.title: All About Bryan Johnson, Tech Millionaire Who Is Trying To 'Reverse' Ageing
item.description: Millionaire tech entrepreneur Bryan Johnson suffered a severe allergic reaction and temporary disfigurement after his recent anti-ageing procedure.

NASA's Curiosity rover heads to new puzzling Martian destination
item.description: After a year of exploring a Martian valley, NASA's Curiosity rover is driving to a new location to explore an unusual "boxwork" formation, where microbes could have existed.

item.description: The best early Black Friday laptop deals include sizable discounts on the M4 Apple MacBook Pro, the Microsoft Surface Laptop 7, and the Lenovo Legion 7i Gen 9.

item.title: SpaceX's sixth Starship test flight successful despite abandoning booster catch
item.description: SpaceX's sixth Starship test flight was largely successful, but plans to catch the first-stage Super Heavy booster were abandoned.
